means: 揭开…的盖子( uncover的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: His long, uncovered hair flew back in the wind.
sentence.Network_cn: 他那露在外面的长发随风向后飞舞。

sentence.Network_en: The three of us manhandled the uncovered dinghy out of the shed.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们三个人把无篷小划艇推出了棚子。

sentence.Network_en: Archaeologists have uncovered an 11,700-year-old hunting camp in Alaska.
sentence.Network_cn: 考古学家在阿拉斯加发现了一个距今11,700年的狩猎营地。

entry.tran: 无覆盖物的；无遮盖的；未盖盖子的
entry.def: Something that is left uncovered does not have anything covering it.

example.ex: Minor cuts and grazes can usually be left uncovered to heal by themselves...
example.tran: 轻微的划伤和擦伤通常不用包扎就可以自愈。

example.ex: The uncovered bucket in the corner stank.
example.tran: 角落里那只未盖盖子的桶散发着臭味。

means.word_mean: 1. not supplied with a cover or covering;
